Package org.jtrim2.collections

Interface EqualityComparator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the objects to be compared
public interface EqualityComparator<T>
Defines an equality comparison between two objects. This interface might be used instead of a java.util.Comparator if no ordering is needed and the natural comparison isn't adequate.

For standard implementations, see the Equality class.

Thread safety

Implementations of this interface are required to be safely usable by multiple threads concurrently; with the assumption that reading properties of the compared objects are thread-safe.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this interface are required to be synchronization transparent.
See Also:

    boolean
    equals(T obj1, T obj2)
    Returns true if the specified objects are to be considered equivalent, false if not.

  • Method Details

    • equals

      boolean equals(T obj1, T obj2)
      Returns true if the specified objects are to be considered equivalent, false if not.

      The equality comparison must have the same properties as defined for the Object.equals(Object) method: reflexive, symmetric, transitive and consistent.

      Special case for null references:

      • If both references are null, this method must return true.
      • If only one of the references are null, this method must return false.
      Parameters:
      obj1 - the first object to be compared. This argument is allowed to be null.
      obj2 - the second object to be compared. This argument is allowed to be null.
      Returns:
      true if the specified objects are to be considered equivalent, false if not
